questions.question_text: Which two statements about Expressway media traversal are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
• An Expressway-E located outside the firewall on the public network or in the DMZ, which acts as the firewall traversal server.

Unified Communications features such as Mobile and Remote Access or Jabber Guest, require a Unified Communications traversal zone connection between the Expressway-C and the Expressway-E. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/admin_guide/X14-0/exwy_b_cisco-expressway-administrator-guide/exwy_m_unified-communications.html
D and E - Zone for MRA is always unfied coms and Expressway E must be deployed in the DMZ segment

choices.B: The Expressway Edge must be put in a firewall DMZ segment.
choices.D: The Unified Communications traversal zone can be used for Mobile and Remote Access.
choices.C: Cisco Unified Communications Manager zone can be either traversal server or client.
choices.A: Expressway Control is the traversal server installed in the DMZ.
choices.E: Both Expressway Edge interfaces can be NATed.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Answer is A
Which type of traversal zone?
• If your deployment is for business to business calling, use a traversal zone.
• If your deployment is for mobile and remote access, use a Unified Communications traversal zone

Unified Communications features such as Mobile and Remote Access or Jabber Guest, require a Unified Communications traversal zone connection between the Expressway-C and the Expressway-E.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/admin_guide/X14-0/exwy_b_cisco-expressway-administrator-guide/exwy_m_unified-communications.html

Answer is D.

Traversal zone (client and server) between E and C.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/admin_guide/X14-0/exwy_b_cisco-expressway-administrator-guide/exwy_m_zones-and-neighbors.html

comments.content: That's to set up a connection from Exp-C to Exp-E. A Unified Communications Traversal Zone is required for MRA to work.

questions.question_text: Which zone is required between Expressway-E and Expressway-C in Mobile and Remote Access deployments?

choices.B: Cisco Unified Communications Manager server certificate

questions.question_text: For a Mobile and Remote Access deployment, which server's certificate must include the Unified registration domain as a Subject Alternate Name?

discussion.content:
The Expressway-E server certificate needs to include the following elements in its list of subject alternative names (SAN):

Unified CM registrations domains

XMPP federation domains

IM and Presence chat node aliases (federated group chat)

Selected Answer: C
Expressway-E server certificate requirements
 The Expressway-E server certificate must include the elements listed below in its list of subject alternative names (SAN). If the Expressway-E is also known by other FQDNs, all of the aliases must be included in the server certificate SAN.
 • Unified CM registrations domains: all of the domains which are configured on the Expressway-C for Unified CM registrations. Required for secure communications between endpoint devices and Expressway-E.
 The Unified CM registration domains used in the Expressway configuration and Expressway-E certificate, are used by Mobile and Remote Access clients to lookup the _collab-edge DNS SRV record during service discovery. They enable MRA registrations on Unified CM, and are primarily for service discovery.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/config_guide/X14-0-2/cert_creation_use/exwy_b_certificate-creation-and-use-deployment-guide-x1402/exwy_b_certificate-creation-use-deployment-guide_chapter_011.html

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/config_guide/X14-0/basic_config/exwy_b_cisco-expressway-e-and-expressway-c-basic-configuration-deployment-guide-x14-0/exwy_m_advanced-networking-deployments.html
The NAT ALG cannot inspect the contents of encrypted signaling message - https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/srnd/collab11/collab11/security.html
Answer is B - AKREM86 is right

A NAT ALG is similar to a firewall ALG, but a NAT ALG actually changes (maps) the addresses and ports in the signaling messages. The NAT ALG cannot inspect the contents of encrypted signaling messages.

questions.question_text:
Cisco Collaboration endpoints are exchanging encrypted signaling messages.
What is one major complication in implementing NAT ALG for voice and video devices?

choices.A: Internal endpoints cannot use addresses from the private address space.
choices.C: NAT ALG introduces jitter in the voice path.
choices.D: Source addresses cannot provide the destination addresses that remote endpoints should use for return packets.
choices.B: The NAT ALG cannot inspect the contents of encrypted signaling messages.
Include Cisco Unified Communications Manager registration domain in the Expressway-E certificate as a SAN.
choices.A: Create a new CSR with new information on the SAN field.
choices.D: Change the FQDN of the Expressway.

questions.question_text:
A Jabber user is being prompted to trust the Expressway-E certificate when using Mobile and Remote Access. The administrator has validated that the
Expressway-E certificate is being trusted by the machine running the Jabber client.
What else can be done to solve this problem?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
khader09s information is correct.

The Unified CM registration domain used for the collab-edge record must be present within the SAN of the Expressway-E certificate. CSR tool in the Expressway server will give you the option to add the Unified CM registration domain as a SAN
